primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus intervenes in human suffering (blindness) to manifest the works of God, leading the hearer from eyesight to insight and personal testimony.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Master stopped, mixed spit with mud, rubbed it on the man's eyes
Jesus did for the blind man what the blind man could not do for himself
that the works of God should be made manifest in him
The power is... in God's will
the blind man received his sight
He has made a change in me
so the blind man's faith might be aroused
commanded the man to go wash
the Pharisees, the constant opponents of Jesus
Mr. Fear-all and his wife, Mrs. We-Can't
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opposition is framed primarily as critical attitudes and legalistic badgering rather than cosmic sin or death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer must testify with authority based on their personal experience of God's power.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (God heals) provides the 'competence' for the secondary program (Man testifies).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Will → Manifestation of Power → The Blind Man/Hearer

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord did something for me
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We like to quote what others have said
If you can't speak a good word, shut up

voorbeelden: we must remember that wrongdoing brings its own punishment
Many of us like to quote
I am an expert in one area

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Savoir' (Knowing) that comes from the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God. It prioritizes the certainty of experience over theoretical knowledge.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Blindness/Theories) through ~S1 (Pharisaic Legalism) to S1 (Personal Authority/Sight).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'One thing I know'—the irrefutable nature of a changed life.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; blindness is a condition to be healed, but legalism is the more active threat.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon maintains God/Jesus as the primary actor in the miracle. Human action (testimony) is a response to divine initiative.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: If you can't speak a good word, shut up

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus did for the blind man what the blind man could not do for himself

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The blind man is used as a model for the hearer's own stance of authority.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on Jesus as the one who seeks out the blind man regardless of his 'authority'.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Assurance of salvation is rooted in the empirical change wrought by God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from God's act (Primary) to the man's testimony (Secondary) is logically and theologically sound.
spanning_punten: The shift from the miracle to a critique of 'pessimistic deacons' feels slightly disconnected from the soteriological depth of the opening.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: saved men and women from the power of sin

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the change to 'Jesus' or 'God' directly, with little mention of the Spirit's specific role.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Moderate; sin is something God has 'power to cleanse' but is framed alongside 'disappointments' and 'hurts'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: Strong theocentric start where Jesus is the Subject. The middle section shifts to a human-centric polemic against critics.

subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Maintain God as the subject of the 'lifting' and 'comforting' verbs.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer might identify too much with the 'expert' status of the man.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the man's 'authority' is entirely derivative and unearned.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'knowing' more explicitly to the 'Spirit's witness' rather than human 'expert knowledge'.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Frame the opponent as the spiritual blindness that only Christ can pierce.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Prevents the sermon from becoming a moralistic critique of 'negative people' in the pews.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The current structure of 'God acts, man responds' is correct.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful sermon that successfully anchors Christian assurance in the objective work of Christ while calling for a bold, experiential testimony.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'pithiness' and metaphors (mud, pharmacy), Greimas reveals the underlying shift from God's action to the man's new competence.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Johannine context of the 'Pool of Siloam'; this analysis focuses on the functional role of the 'Helper' (mud/faith).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'authority' the preacher speaks of is actually a 'Modal Competence' (Savoir-faire) granted by the Subject (Jesus) to the Receiver.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (passed by, stopped, mixed, rubbed, commanded, gave answer, did, opened)
The man (received, took stand, rested authority, knows)
God (is able, can build, found us)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Subject-Switch' where God's performance creates a new Subject (the Witness) who then performs the secondary task of testifying.
